author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Like goats in high pastures, they climb,
As stock futures edge to sublime,
Toward inflation's cruel snare,
In July's burnished glare.

Again, the goats thither incline,
Stock futures in a daring climb,
A snail's blink to Wednesday's reveal,
Under the summer's golden wheel.

The rabbit in her burrow keen,
Awaits the data yet unseen.
Gilt yields steady in their keep,
While U.K. labour's secrets sleep.

feedItems.title: Stock Futures Edge Higher
feedItems.description: Investors’ attention is turning back to inflation this week, with the consumer-price index for July due Wednesday.

feedItems.title: Stock Futures Edge Higher
feedItems.description: Investors’ attention is turning back to inflation this week, with the consumer-price index for July due Wednesday.

feedItems.title: Gilt Yields Relatively Steady Ahead of Key Data Releases This Week
feedItems.description: Gilt yields are relatively steady as investors await major data releases this week including U.K. labor market data on Tuesday, and U.K. and U.S. inflation data on Wednesday.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In blackened abyss where Serpents dwell,
Oil embraces Thor's might, quaking under a spell,
As Midgard braces for a storm from Jotun-sire's well,
The eye of Heimdall keenly watches the prophecy foretell.

A Sterling lingers on Fate's imperfect scale,
Whilst data and numbers through Mimir's well doth sail,
Odin’s ravens whisper of wealth turning pale,
On the BOE's forge, where interest-rate whims prevail.

Hear a tale from the East, where sunlight first gleams,
Of Bharti, a wolf seeking wealth in foreign streams,
Acquiring BT's rune, under Altice's moonbeam,
A formidable alliance, their power supreme.

feedItems.title: Oil Edges Higher as Markets Brace for Iran Retaliation
feedItems.description: Oil prices edged higher as markets continued to closely monitor geopolitical risks, with Iran’s retaliation against Israel in response to the killing of Hamas’s political leader believed to be imminent.

feedItems.title: Sterling Could Fall if Key U.K. Data Miss Forecasts
feedItems.description: Sterling could fall as U.K. employment and inflation data later in the week might come in slightly below expectations, potentially boosting BOE interest-rate cut expectations, ING said.

feedItems.title: India's Bharti to Buy Altice Stake in BT
feedItems.description: Bharti has agreed to buy a 24.5% stake in BT from Altice for an undisclosed amount, but said it had no intention of making an offer for the U.K. telecom group.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Fields of Gold, behold! A pact there grows,
Osisko and the South seek gilded spree,
Their thirst for control, as freely it flows,
In merry Canada we'll see this decree.

The Dragon's Bank, with stern and watchful eyes,
Bravely embarks to test bond-riddled stress,
That lurking risk might brew no ill surprise,
Ale for serenity they wish to possess.

Fair Kamala, with hearty donors lined,
Presses the soil of her Californian stead,
With Silicon's bigwigs she hath aligned,
A wine-flushed election feast ahead she led.

feedItems.title: Gold Fields to Buy Canadian Miner Osisko
feedItems.description: Gold Fields is set to buy Osisko Mining for $1.6 billion, giving the South African company full control of the Windfall project in Canada as it seeks to secure supply with gold prices soaring.

feedItems.title: China's Central Bank to Examine Financial Institutions' Bond Risks
feedItems.description: The People’s Bank of China is set to conduct stress tests on financial institutions’ exposure to bond holdings, in the latest effort to rein in a monthslong rally and prevent fallout risks.

feedItems.title: Kamala Harris Taps California Roots---and Elite Donors---to Boost Election Bid
feedItems.description: The fundraiser drew $12 million and 700 people, including bigwigs from Silicon Valley.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In Syria’s heart, ‘neath desert’s palm and date,
A spectre rises ‘gainst decency’s state.
Ungodly force born half a decade past,
Now thrives anew in chaos unsurpassed.

In vaulted halls of mercantile grace,
Men paid the price for unbridled pace.
They rallied, borrowed, gambled in the fray,
Now rue the losses of the tumultuous day.

Upon the Eastern front, Ukraine thus stands,
In Russian soil, they mark with firm hands.
Quick gains won tenfold, ‘midst a year of strife,
Yet outnumbered still, they wager life.

feedItems.title: In Syria's Hinterlands, the U.S. Wages a Hidden Campaign Against a Resurgent Islamic State
feedItems.description: Defeated by American-led forces half a decade ago, the terrorist group is rebounding amid the chaos of the Middle East.

feedItems.title: Investors Borrowed Like Crazy During the Rally. Now They're Paying the Price.
feedItems.description: Behind the market tumult of the past month: the rapid unwind of several popular trades and the heavy use of leverage

feedItems.title: Ukraine's Russia Incursion Faces Dilemma After Quick Gains
feedItems.description: Following a year of brutal defensive warfare, Ukraine’s new operation has quickly taken territory in Russia’s Kursk province. But Kyiv’s forces are still outgunned and outnumbered in most places.
